✨ 3 Ways to Plop ✨⁣
⁣
➰ Wet Plop - gives your products the opportunity to fully saturate your hair and promote definition.⁣ (technique credit: @hif3licia )
⁣
➰ Plop (or some refer to it as “dry plop”) - gentle way to begin drying your hair while keeping it curled up inside the towel. This will begin the drying process and may help with encouraging your natural pattern. I also do this step to help keep my hair off my face while applying makeup and getting dressed.⁣
⁣
➰ Micro-Plop - A quicker way to remove excess water while scrunching to encourage your natural pattern. Do this gently to avoid unwanted frizz. Want to know how I’ve cut the most minutes off of my diffusing time? This step is it!⁣
⁣
So which one is the best? That depends on your goals.❤️ I use each of these methods routinely during my washdays and encourage you to give them a try!⁣
⁣

Hair Care is Self Care.⁣
⁣
I hear too often that as a wavy I do “too much” and I should just straighten it if I have to put in “this much work.”⁣
⁣
This isn’t work. For many of us, this is self care. ⁣
⁣
So by all means…⁣
➰Use one product or 7 in your routine ⁣
➰Take 30 mins or 2 hours to style⁣
➰ Use products that cost $3 or $100+⁣
➰ Scrunch, brush, air dry, diffuse, plop or even straighten if that’s what suits YOU. ⁣
⁣
No one should make you feel “less than” or “too much” for the decisions you make about the hair on your head. Keep doing what works for you. We celebrate all textures here ❤️
⁣
*PS - I’d never actually tell someone to shut up.⁣
I’m a lot friendlier than that. 😉⁣
⁣
___⁣

My 20 Minute Diffusing Routine⁣
⁣
➰ Hover until you feel the product cast forming⁣
➰ Pixie to add volume and bounce⁣
➰ I dry to 100% dry then use 3 drops of oil or a pump of emulsified foam to break the cast and fluff out my hair.⁣
⁣
✨Tip: to speed up drying time, micro-plop before diffusing to remove excess water (This was a game changer for me!)⁣
⁣
What’s your favorite diffusing tip? Share with us below. You never know who it will help ❤️⁣

Unwanted opinions will be left in 2022 💋⁣
⁣
⁣
Shout out to @brianahamer.stylist for bringing this chocolatey dimension to life!⁣
⁣
___⁣
⁣
🎨 What I asked for:⁣
⁣
➰ Face framing highlights - I wanted a pop of brightness around my face to enhance the dimension, but also ease me into how dark we were going.⁣
➰ Target a shade slightly darker than my natural hair color.⁣
➰ Leave out some of the blonde to be toned down and add dimension to the overall look (highlights and lowlights POP in wavy/curly hair!)⁣
⁣
🎨 How she did it:⁣
⁣
➰ All over lowlights (about 85-90% off my hair)⁣
➰ Demi-permanent color to maintain a softer grow out and gentler on the hair. This also allows for us to go lighter down the road, if we choose, and we don’t have to fight through permanent color which could cause worse damage.⁣
➰ Toned the remaining blonde to an ashier blonde vs the warmer blonde I had before.⁣
⁣
⁣
❓Do you still color your hair? If so, what’s your natural shade and the color you ask for?⁣

Simplified Wavy (or curly) Refresh Routine⁣
⁣
This is my go-to routine to add back both definition and volume that may have been lost from extending my washday. ⁣
⁣
📓Note: I only reintroduce water back into my refresh if I’m wanting more definition in my waves. The reason being that water usually create more frizz on my refresh days, but also revives some of the waves that may have lost some shape. ⁣
⁣
Otherwise, I keep it super simple and only use a foam on dry hair. By the time I make it to day 4+, water becomes necessary for me. Always do what suits you💋⁣
⁣
_____⁣

“I don’t have wavy or curly hair. It’s just kind of frizzy, puffy and unruly.” - Me circa...my entire life.⁣
⁣
It’s been 4 years since I started my healthy hair journey and when I chose to stop believing I just have “bad hair.” ⁣
⁣
So what was the the thing that mostly made this transformation happen? Time. Sorry, that wasn’t the answer you were hoping for, right?⁣
⁣
Of course, learning the right application techniques for my hair type, the products my hair favors the most and quitting heat are massive factors. Each of these things alone take time. ⁣
⁣
There’s no miracle product or application technique to transform damaged hair overnight. However, investing time in learning your hair’s needs and wants, while cutting out excessive heat, will help start your transformation.⁣
⁣
The journey can be fun and it can really suck (sorry, that’s just the truth...no one is immune to transition 🥴), but it’s 100% worth it.⁣
⁣
You’ve got this.⁣

Pro-tip: wet the rubber on the brush to help it glide in or out more easily. ⁣
⁣
___ ⁣
⁣
Did you know you can alter your Denman brush to best suit your curl pattern depending on your desired results?⁣
⁣
The sturdy nylon bristles allow for balanced tension to help define your waves, curls and coils. Which makes it a cult favorite in the curly community.⁣
⁣
Quick tips if you haven’t found success with your Denman styling brush: ⁣
➰If you have a tighter curl pattern, try more rows. ⁣
➰If you have a looser wave or curl pattern, try less rows. ⁣
➰If the brush easily snags, the row of pins may be too close together. Try removing every other row to see if that works better for your hair type and desired result. ⁣
⁣
*NOTE: These are tips, not rules. What works for some won’t work for all. Experiment to find what suites you.⁣
⁣
_____⁣
⁣

You know what’s great about wavy/curly hair? It’s versatile. 💋⁣
⁣
I know, I know. We’re told not to use heat tools on our hair. However, when done properly and in moderation, you can successfully rock a heat styled look without all the damage.⁣
⁣
So If you’re waiting for someone to give you permission to do a blow out..girl, go for it! Just make sure to use protection 😉⁣
⁣
____⁣
⁣
Tips I follow when doing a blow out:⁣
⁣
➰Deep condition to prep (both before and after a heat styled look)⁣
⁣
➰Dry your hair as much as possible before you resort to heat (use a cotton shirt or microfiber towel to remove excess water before beginning to blow dry)⁣
⁣
➰Use a heat protectant (@Briogeo Farewell Frizz is my go-to and happens to be CG approved.) ⁣
⁣
➰Keep an eye on your heat settings (suggested around 200° F, but do what you’re comfortable with) and hit your hair with a cool shot of air to help set the shape.
⁣
💡Not ready to sweat the heat? Try an overnight heatless curl tutorial. There are so many to be found on social media and YouTube.⁣
⁣
⁣
Do you rock a a blow out from time to time? Share your protective tips with us below ⬇️⁣
⁣

Anyone else said this to themselves? 🙋🏻‍♀️⁣
⁣
So what was the the thing that most made this transformation happen? Time. Sorry, that wasn’t the answer you were hoping for, right?⁣
⁣
But here is the most important question: Is it worth it? ⁣
⁣
100% yes, but not just because your hair gets healthier, rather your perception of your own unique beauty gets healthier. ⁣
⁣
________⁣
⁣
A few helpful notes:⁣
⁣
➰No one and I mean NO ONE is immune to bad hair days.⁣
⁣
-➰ Don’t compare your Day 1 to someone else’s Month 10⁣
⁣
➰Embrace and love YOUR natural pattern(s). Having goals for 3b hair when you’re naturally a 2a are unrealistic (and will only lead to disappointment)⁣
 ⁣
➰ Bought a new product and it didn’t work the first time? Try it again. Then again and again. Trying something once, one way, will not be sufficient enough to tell if it works. Which brings me to my next point...⁣
⁣
➰ Don’t buy ALL the things to get started, focus on your application techniques and research products before you buy them. Not sure how to research? Take a texture quiz (I have one linked in my bio), then use that information to start digging.⁣
⁣
➰ There’s no miracle product or application technique to transform damaged hair overnight. However, investing time in learning your hair’s needs and wants, while cutting out excessive heat, will help start your transformation.⁣ ⁣
⁣
➰ Lastly, I’ll say this until I’m blue in the face: do what works for you. One size does not fit all.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
It doesn’t matter where you start...just start.💋⁣

⁣Struggle achieving a cast? Below are some quick tips that might help⬇️⁣
⁣
_____⁣
⁣
But first, what is a cast?⁣
⁣
➰ Simply put - it’s a hard shell of product that forms around your curl clumps as it dries. This helps reduce frizz while drying and maintains definition.⁣
⁣
⁣_____⁣
⁣
Ways to achieve a stronger cast:⁣
⁣
➰ Ensure your curls are sufficiently coated with product⁣
➰ Remove a little more water before adding your last styler ⁣
➰ Use a harder hold styler ⁣(products containing Aloe or Flaxseed tend to work best for me)⁣
➰ If using heat to dry, bring the temperature down. ⁣
➰ Use an alcohol-free hairspray on wet/damp hair ⁣
➰ Keep your hands off while drying!⁣
➰ Try smasters technique (shown above) - dry hair to 50%, then apply a little more of your styler.⁣ Finish drying.⁣
⁣

My Favorite Humidity Tips ✨⁣
⁣
Now let me be clear, glycerin can positively and negatively impact everyone’s hair differently. Overall, it can do a wonderful job keeping moisture in your hair. Now everyone’s hair has different levels of tolerance for glycerin in varying dew points. When it comes to high dew points, my tolerance stops around 70+ degrees. The tips below are my go-to when this happens.⁣
⁣
As always, learn your own hair’s wants and needs as you experiment ❤️⁣
⁣
____⁣
My top humidity tips:⁣
⁣
➰ Finish hair with a low to no glycerin foam (shown above)⁣
➰ Scrunch out the crunch with a low to no glycerin foam⁣
➰ Don’t break the cast at all - If the dew points are very high, they’ll naturally soften your cast over the course of the day.⁣
⁣
⁣
What these may help with:⁣
⁣
➰ Combat humidity⁣
➰ Extra hold at the end of your washday⁣
➰ Smooth down any excess frizz after drying⁣
➰ Add shine⁣
⁣
⁣
….Or simply embrace it! I occasionally love the mega volume I get from the extra moisture in the air.⁣

How to flip upright after upside down styling✨⁣
⁣
Creating movement during each step of the styling process will allow your hair to fall where it wants to…naturally.⁣

➰Gently roll hair from side to side and upside while drying. This will also help with root volume whether you air dry or diffuse.⁣
➰Lift the root with your fingers to help loosen any areas that may be trying to stick to the scalp. This will also encourage your hair to fall more naturally.⁣

Why I Stopped Pixie Diffusing My Wavy Hair✨⁣
⁣
Pixie diffusing works wonders for extra volume, however it frequently caused my wavy hair to dry wonky the closer it got to my root. This is especially true for my bottom layers as they tend to dry in a looser pattern and don’t want to “curl” up into the diffuser (this is totally normally to have multiple patterns!)⁣
⁣
Cupping my hair has worked so well with my natural wave and encourages it to dry the way it wants to.⁣
⁣
Here are some of the benefits for me:⁣
⁣
➰ More consistency in my pattern and final results⁣
➰ Improved defintion⁣
➰ Decreased frizz as the airflow is directed downward, in the direction of the cuticle⁣
➰ Improved volume at the root⁣
➰ Longer last washdays and less of a need to refresh.⁣

Night Time Refresh and Sleep Protection Tutorial✨⁣
⁣
Refreshing is usually something we see done in the morning, however I’ve found refreshing before bed has saved me so much time and energy as it adds an extra layer of protection while sleeping.⁣
⁣
I use a foam or a mousse on dry hair and let the product form a slight cast. This cast helps hold my waves in place as I sleep. Most mornings, it’s a minute or two of fluffing and settling and then I’m done. ⁣
⁣
 ____⁣
⁣
Additional Tips:⁣
⁣
➰ Great refreshes start from great washdays. Take the time on washday and it will save you time when refreshing.⁣
⁣
➰ I only tie my hair up one time around, this is just enough to hold my hair up and off my face without crushing my waves. Make it tighter, if needed for your hair type.⁣
⁣
➰ In a high pony, I drap my hair over the top of my pillow to avoid rolling onto my hair while sleeping⁣
⁣
➰ I sleep with two pillows (preference), both are covered with a silk or satin pillowcase to reduce friction, frizz….and it’s great for your skin!⁣
⁣
___⁣

✨What is a gel cast and how do I get one? ⁣✨⁣
⁣
⁣
Firstly, never judge a cast before it’s broken.⁣
⁣
This is what my cast looks like 99% of the time. It’s a tad wonky with a side of confused. That said, it doesn’t mean my washday has failed. ⁣
⁣
⁣
____⁣
⁣
What is a gel cast?⁣
⁣
➰ Simply put - it’s a hard shell of product that forms around your curl clumps as it dries. This helps reduce frizz while drying and maintains definition.⁣
⁣
Struggle achieving a cast? Here are just some quick tips that might help:⁣
⁣
⁣
➰ Ensure your waves and curls are sufficiently coated with product⁣
➰ Remove a little more water before adding your hardest hold styler ⁣
➰ Use a harder hold styler ⁣(products containing Aloe or Flaxseed tend to work best for me)⁣
➰ If using heat to dry, bring the temperature down. ⁣
➰ Use alcohol free hairspray on wet/damp hair ⁣
➰ Keep your hands off while drying ⁣
➰ Try smasters technique - dry hair to 50%, then apply a little more of your styler.⁣ Finish drying.⁣
⁣
⁣
What are your favorite tricks to achieving a cast? Share with us below ⬇️ and save this post to reference the comments later.

It’s more than just “frizzy, puffy hair”…I promise 💛⁣
⁣
With the right application techniques, experimenting and time I finally found the hair I loved. Along with the health of my hair improving,  the perception of my own unique beauty got healthier with it.⁣
⁣
______⁣
⁣
If I may share some advice I learned from my own healthy hair journey:⁣
⁣
⁣
➰ Try your products several times and in several ways before you cut them out. Even then, hang on to them and try again in a few months. As your hair gets healthier, it’s needs may change.⁣
⁣
➰ That said, keep your peepers on those expiration dates 👀⁣
⁣
➰ Practice your application technique (I did this and this alone for the first 9 months of my healthy hair journey. Game 👏🏼Changer👏🏼!) which brings me to my next point...⁣
⁣
➰ You don’t need ALL the products!⁣
⁣
➰ Listen to YOUR hair, not just what everyone else is doing.
⁣
➰  Ingredients are listed in order of concentration (99% of the time, at least. There are some stragglers that list alphabetically.) Take a peak at the first 5-6 ingredients to get a sense of what your product is really about...not just what the product is marketing to you.⁣
⁣
➰ One method is not a one size fits all.⁣
⁣
➰ Try your best not to compare your journey to someone else’s. Our hairs have their own unique finger print of chemical, thermal and mechanical damage. It’s impossible to put an exact time stamp on how long it will take to bounce back.⁣
⁣
➰ If you’re seeking permission to blow out your hair from time to time, here it is, fam 🙋🏻‍♀️ Just promise me you’ll use some form of heat protection.⁣
⁣
➰ Lastly, if you’re like me and need some repetition to commit something to memory, DO WHAT WORKS FOR YOU!⁣
⁣

Simple Brushed Waves Refresh ✨⁣
⁣
➰ Let me start out by stating the obvious...This will NOT work for everyone! If you have a looser wave/curl pattern or finer hair, this could work for you. If your unsure, it’s always worth an experiment!⁣
⁣
➰ I like to do this when my hair is on day 3+ and there is no reviving my stretched out, overly frizzy waves and curls with a normal refresh.⁣
⁣
➰ For a more natural look, praying hands and scrunch in the product. ⁣
⁣
➰ For a more “blown out/curled” look, brush and twist OR finger curl each section. ⁣
⁣
➰ Great for those who experience a lot of tangles and matting as you move further into your refresh days.⁣
⁣
➰ For best results, work with hair in sections! Since you’ve brushed your hair, it’s more likely to “fluff” up. Working with it in sections we’ll help you properly saturate your hair and reactivate the shape.⁣

Simple wavy hair routine ✨⁣
⁣
Sometimes I just want really loose beachy waves and this routine does the trick every time 🌊⁣
⁣
➰Application is easy and drying time is quick due to the minimal amount of product in my hair.⁣

➰ Fluff at the roots once 100% dry to achieve some lift and body. ⁣

The Bowl Method ⁣
⁣
It’s been several years since I’ve done this method and I started to wonder why. After seeing it pop-up on my feed by many others that achieved killer results, I knew I needed to pull out the bowl (or container in my case) and give this a try again.⁣
⁣
____⁣
⁣
Let’s just say…I have feelings about it. Allow me to summarize:⁣
⁣
➰ The bowl method is great for clumping. Lots of water tends to make hair clump together a bit more easily. ⁣
⁣
➰ I used more curl cream than usual since I was going to be dunking it into a container of water. I didn’t love this as I saw a lot of that great product dripping back into the bowl.⁣
⁣
➰ That said…this is done to help distribute said product by continuously dunking the hair into the water/product mixture.⁣
⁣
➰ My back was not having it.⁣
⁣
➰ The results were beautiful. Super soft and fluffy! ⁣
⁣
⁣
Would I do this again? Not anytime soon. I prefer using a brush to distribute product and to section my hair to ensure all my strands are well saturated with my gel and/or foam. I also prefer to remain upright for most of my routine (outside of diffusing because…VOLUME 🔊)⁣
⁣
Overall, I simply prefer my normal routine and that’s ok.⁣
⁣
As I always says (seriously, I say it on most posts), do what works for YOU. One size is never fits all. This method is awesome for some and not for others. You have to experiment for yourself 💛⁣
⁣

My healthy/wavy hair journey✨⁣
⁣

I’ve always had a deep love for voluminous, wavy/curly hair. I’ve envied it for as long as I can remember, but it wasn’t until my first baby was born that I started to question what my own hair could possibly look like. Up until then I had always said, “I don’t have wavy or curly hair, it’s just somewhere between frizzy and straight.” Sound familiar? Keep reading.⁣
⁣
My son was born with a full head of thick, black hair. As he got a few months older is started to curl and I had no idea where it came from or how to take care of it. It was around 6 months old that someone made the suggestion that I ditch shampoo and only use conditioner on his hair. This sounded wild to me, but what could it hurt to try? Needless to say, it lead be down a rabbit hole of hair education. His curls had never looked better and I started to question who exactly those beautiful spirals came from.⁣
⁣
I committed to my own healthy hair journey at that point. I wanted my son and any of my future children to find beauty in their natural texture. I also wanted to show them that other’s textures are beautiful as-is. We don’t need to manipulate our hair to fit a beauty standard...something that I had done my entire life.⁣
⁣
⁣
So tell me your story...what made you go natural with your hair? ⬇️⁣

I was really just going for “healthy.” ⁣

On nearly every post I’ve made for the last several months, I’ve had threads of comments debating my hair type. I would occasionally respond until they started getting heated. Calling each other “uneducated” when someone would say it was wavy or “stupid” because someone else called it curly.⁣ 

I never mind the debate, but I do mind the cruelty towards one another.

Let me be clear: My goal for starting this page was not to achieve a certain pattern or have it be labeled a certain way. It never will be. Rather, I started this page as an outlet for me to learn my hair needs, learn how to style it in a way the works for my lifestyle and to share what I’ve learned along the way to help those on a similar journey find this process a little easier.⁣
⁣
So not only did I achieve healthier hair, the perception of my own unique beauty got healthier.⁣

No matter how you label it, it’s healthy and I’m happy.⁣

Frizz Tips ⬇️⁣
⁣
If you see frizz while wet, you’ll see frizz when dry ✨⁣
⁣
Let me start by saying that frizz is a completely normal part of having texture to your hair. Frankly, no one is immune to it (and it can actually give you killer volume 🔊)⁣
⁣
However, sometimes we want to reduce frizz for a softer result.  Here are some of my favorite tips for reducing frizz on washday:⁣
⁣
➰ Use a styling brush on wet hair to smooth down wet frizz and help clumps form. I do this after applying my gel.⁣
➰ Avoid hot water.
➰ Limit scrunching if your hair is prone to frizz.
➰ Use a cotton or micro-fiber towel⁣.
➰ Hands off when diffusing (try hover diffusing).
➰ Lower the temperature setting on your diffuser as heat can soften the product cast.
➰ Try a stronger hold styler or smidge more product if your hair isn’t holding together when drying.
➰ Use a pump of foam, emulsified, on dry hair to break any cast that formed and to help tame any frizz in the final result.
⁣
See my post before this for how I use my styling brush.⁣
⁣
⁣

Hairspray Only Washday ✨⁣
⁣
I did NOT see those results coming 👀 TBH I thought this was going to be a total waste of a washday. My typical routine requires both a gel and foam, so dialing it all the way back to just a bit of (*Alochol Free*) hairspray didn’t sound like something I wanted to do.⁣
⁣
STEPS:⁣
⁣
➰ Section hair (I do top half and bottom half)⁣
➰ Lightly mist hair with alcohol free hairspray on wet hair⁣
➰ Brush style to distribute product and form clumps⁣
➰ Spray hairspray into hands and scrunch⁣
➰ Dry as desired⁣
➰ Break the crunchy product cast with 2-3 drops of oil⁣ by scrunching and using praying hands
⁣
⁣
___⁣
⁣
Here are my thoughts:⁣
⁣
➰ This hairspray is very sticky, so it offered a decent hold⁣.
➰…but because it’s so sticky, it would be easy to overdue it and end up with tacky hair (so start small and work your way up!)⁣
➰ I reapplied a bit more at 50% dry when I felt my hair was still very soft. This added more hold and prevented me from going overboard.⁣
➰ Exceptionally lightweight styler option, probably the lightest I’ve ever tried.⁣
➰ Some strands picked up more hairspray than others and were more stubborn to break the cast. ⁣
➰ My ends looked a lot more stringy than I’d like. I could likely go without scrunching in the hairspray at the end.⁣
➰ Styling took only 5 minutes⁣.
➰Drying took only 15 MINUTES. 🤯⁣
⁣
VERDICT: I’m 100% doing this again, especially for days I’m sort on time. This was by far my quickest washday to-date.⁣
⁣

Never judge a cast before it’s broken ✨
⁣
This is what my gel cast looks like 99% of the time. It’s a tad wonky with a side of confused. That said, it doesn’t mean my washday has failed. ⁣
⁣
____⁣
⁣
What is a gel cast?⁣
⁣
➰ Simply put - it’s a hard shell of product that forms around your curl clumps as it dries. This helps reduce frizz while drying and maintains definition.⁣
⁣
⁣____⁣
⁣
Struggle achieving a cast? Here are just some quick tips that might help:⁣
⁣
➰ Ensure your curls are sufficiently coated with product⁣
➰ Remove a little more water before adding your hardest hold styler ⁣
➰ Use a harder hold styler ⁣(products containing Aloe or Flaxseed tend to work best for me)⁣
➰ If using heat to dry, bring the temperature down. ⁣Heat can soften the cast while drying, making it harder to form.⁣
➰ Use hairspray on wet/damp hair ⁣
➰ Keep your hands off while drying ⁣
➰ Try smasters technique - dry hair to 50%, then apply a little more of your styler.⁣ Finish drying.⁣
⁣
💨 Once finished, I take 2-3 drops of oil OR 1 pump of foam to smooth and scrunch the cast out of my hair to reveal soft waves and curls.⁣
⁣

My top 5 ways to speed up drying time ⬇️⁣
⁣
➰ Create smaller curl clumps while styling to help from trapping excess water in the curls ⁣
⁣
➰ Try lightweight stylers such as foam/mousse or dial back a smidge on how much product used in your routine ⁣
⁣
➰ Gently micro-plop before drying to squeeze out any excess water ⁣
⁣
➰ Mist your hair with a light coat of alcohol free hairspray right before drying⁣
⁣
➰ Scrunch out the crunch around 80-90% dry to release the product cast and help find any hidden damp spots (NOTE: if your hair tends to frizz easily or your hair is damaged, I would suggest avoiding this step as it can creat additional unwanted frizz).⁣
⁣

We all start as beginners ✨⁣
⁣
Funny truth - when I began my healthy hair journey, I thought you were supposed to leave ALL the conditioner in your hair (queue the first photo). Mmm no. Not for my hair, at least. Remember - what works for some does not work does all.⁣
⁣
Now don’t get me wrong, I was impressed with these initial results. I fried my hair for 15+ years and continued to bleach it up until 2 yrs into my healthy hair journey. So to see my hair take any shape was a win in my book.⁣
⁣
The biggest thing from one photo to the next is time. Time to practice, time learn and time to heal my damaged hair. ⁣
⁣
But here is the most important question: Is it worth it? ⁣
⁣
100% yes, but not just because your hair gets healthier, rather your perception of your own unique beauty gets healthier. ⁣
⁣
⁣
**All these photos were taken in December. The first photo is my very first washday on this journey.⁣
________⁣
⁣
A few helpful notes:⁣
⁣
➰No one and I mean NO ONE is immune to bad hair days.⁣
⁣
➰ Don’t compare your Day 1 to someone else’s Year 1⁣
⁣
➰Embrace and love YOUR natural pattern(s). Having goals for 3b hair when you’re naturally a 2a are unrealistic (and will only lead to disappointment)⁣
 ⁣
➰ Bought a new product and it didn’t work the first time? Try it again. Then again and again. Trying something once, one way, will not be sufficient enough to tell if it works. Which brings me to my next point...⁣
⁣
➰ Don’t buy ALL the things to get started, focus on your application techniques and research products before you buy them.⁣
⁣
➰ There’s no miracle product or application technique to transform damaged hair overnight. However, investing time in learning your hair’s needs and wants, while cutting out excessive heat, will help start your transformation.⁣ ⁣
⁣
➰ Lastly, I’ll say this until I’m blue in the face: do what works for you. One size does not fit all.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
It doesn’t matter where you start...just start.💋⁣

Apple Cider Vinegar (ACV) rinse✨⁣
⁣
There are many benefits to an ACV rinse and it’s incredibly simple to do. Some benefits include:⁣
⁣
➰ Removes product build up ⁣
➰ Reduces frizz⁣
➰ Relieves an itchy scalp⁣
➰ Eases detangling⁣
➰ Improves shine⁣
... and so much more.⁣
___⁣
⁣
WHAT YOU NEED:⁣
⁣
➰ Apple Cider Vinegar (“With the Mother” - this is noted on the label of the product).⁣
➰ Container/Bowl ⁣
➰ Optional: Cup or bottle to bring solution back into your hair (or just dip your hair into the bowl)⁣
⁣
___⁣
⁣
RECIPE:⁣
⁣
➰ 2 cups of water⁣
➰ 1.5 tablespoons of ACV (with the mother)⁣
⁣
*Be sure to always dilute your ACV with water before using. This will bring down the PH on the mixture.⁣
___⁣

The smell of fried hair never leaves you.⁣ 
⁣
___⁣
⁣
Struggling with frizz? Here are some tips ⬇️⁣
⁣
Let me start by saying that frizz is a completely normal part of having texture to your hair. Frankly, no one is immune to it (and it can actually give you killer volume 🔊)⁣
⁣
However, sometimes we want to reduce it for a softer result.  Here are some of my favorite tips for reducing frizz in washday:⁣
⁣
➰ Use a styling brush on wet hair to smooth down wet frizz and help clumps form. I do this after applying my gel.⁣
➰ Avoid hot water ⁣
➰ Limit scrunching if your hair is prone to frizz.⁣
➰ Use a cotton or micro-fiber towel⁣
➰ Hands off when diffusing (try hover diffusing).⁣
➰ Lower the temperature setting on your diffuser as heat can soften the product cast.⁣
➰ Try a stronger hold styler or smidge more product if your hair isn’t holding together when drying.⁣
➰ Use a pump of foam, emulsified, on dry hair to break any cast that formed and to help tame any frizz in the final result.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣

“I don’t have wavy or curly hair. It’s just kind of frizzy, puffy and unruly.” - Me circa...my entire life.⁣
⁣
It’s been almost 5 years since I started my healthy hair journey and when I chose to stop believing I just have “bad hair.” ⁣
⁣
So what was the the thing that mostly made this transformation happen? Time. Sorry, that wasn’t the answer you were hoping for, right?⁣
⁣
Of course, learning the right application techniques for my hair type, the products my hair favors the most and quitting heat are massive factors. Each of these things alone take time. ⁣
⁣
There’s no miracle product or application technique to transform damaged hair overnight. However, investing time in learning your hair’s needs and wants, while cutting out excessive heat, will help start your transformation.⁣
⁣
The journey can be fun and it can really suck (sorry, that’s just the truth...no one is immune to transition 🥴), but it’s 100% worth it.⁣
⁣
You’ve got this.⁣

3 Ways to Plop
⁣
➰ Wet Plop - gives your products the opportunity to fully saturate your hair and promote definition.⁣ ⁣Time: 10-15mins
*(technique credit: @hif3licia )⁣
⁣
➰ Plop - A gentle way to begin drying your hair while keeping it curled up inside the towel. This will begin the drying process and may help with encouraging your natural pattern. I also do this step to help keep my hair off my face while applying makeup and getting dressed.⁣ Time: 15-20 mins
⁣
➰ Micro-Plop - A quicker way to remove excess water while scrunching to encourage your natural pattern. Do this gently to avoid unwanted frizz. Want to know how I’ve cut the most minutes off of my diffusing time? This step is it!⁣ Time: As desired (I squish until damp)
⁣
So which one is the best? That depends on your goals.❤️ I use each of these methods routinely during my washdays and encourage you to give them a try!⁣

We all start as beginners.
⁣
I’m such a sucker for before and after photos. I LOVE them! Not just because of the progress we see, but mostly because I know just how much time, energy, effort, frustration and love has been put into making that progress happen.⁣
⁣
This didn’t happen overnight, as you can see, the time between these posts are years and my hair is still changing.⁣
⁣
Yeah, that’s a LONG time! ⁣
⁣
It took about 6 months into this journey for me to get results that I actually liked. This timeline will be different for everyone. I started with bleached hair that had been heat styled for over 15yrs and refused to do a reset cut. So I knew I had a long road ahead of me. I also refused to believe that one method was the end all, be all. One size doesn’t fill all.⁣
⁣
Experiment to learn YOUR hair needs and do what works for you ❤️⁣ not sure where to start? My page is loaded with tips, tricks and tutorials. 

🎥 Full washday and refresh tutorials available on my YouTube channel (link in bio).⁣

❓ How long have you been on your healthier hair journey? 
❓How long were you or have you been in transition for? 
❓What/Who has motivated you to keep going?

Share with us below ⬇️⁣

#naturallywavy #wavycurly #hairtransformation #curlcare #wavyhair  #wavyhairtutorial #wavyhairroutine #hairtips #beachwaves #diffusing #curlpattern #hairroutine
⁣

No method is a one size fits all. ⁣
⁣
And I don’t say that from just a results perspective. I say that from angles such as time you have to style, desired results, end goal, versatility and so on.⁣
⁣
I spent the first 9 months of my hair journey doing the CG Method. Honestly, it worked great. I’m absolutely NOT saying it didn’t work as it was intended to. My hair was growing out healthier than ever and my waves were bouncing back like I’d not seen before.⁣
⁣
However, the time I spent styling and the end result ultimately didn’t work for me and that’s ok! I experimented and I learned. Which is what I always talk about on this page.⁣
⁣
Once I learned the rules, I learned how to break them in a way that worked for me. With the right application techniques, experimenting and time I finally found the hair I loved and it crossed the lines of what was allowed and wasn’t allowed in the CGM world. ⁣
⁣
Lastly, with the health of my hair improving, the perception of my own unique beauty got healthier with it.⁣..and THAT was my desired end result.⁣
⁣
______⁣
⁣
If I may share some additional advice I learned from my own healthy hair journey:⁣
⁣
⁣
➰ Practice your application technique (I did this and this alone for the first 9 months of my healthy hair journey. Game 👏🏼Changer👏🏼!) which brings me to my next point...⁣
⁣
➰ You don’t need ALL the products!⁣
⁣
➰ Listen to YOUR hair, not just what is working for everyone else. ⁣
⁣
➰ Keep your hair goals at the forefront, always! It’s easy to get caught up in all the new techniques, products and tools. But if it doesn’t serve you, you don’t need to feel guilty or “less than” for not trying them.⁣
⁣
⁣
➰ Try your best not to compare your journey to someone else’s. Our hairs have their own unique finger print of chemical, thermal and mechanical damage. It’s impossible to put an exact time stamp on how long it will take to bounce back.⁣
⁣
➰ DO WHAT WORKS FOR YOU!⁣
⁣
_____⁣
⁣
💡 What’s your favorite piece of advice you’ve picked up?⁣

We all start somewhere.⁣
⁣
Fun fact: I used to rake mousse into damp/dry hair. Then I would brush it 👀 ⁣
⁣
⁣5 years later and I’ve learned a few things 💛⁣
________⁣
⁣
A few helpful notes:⁣
⁣
➰No one and I mean NO ONE is immune to bad hair days.⁣
⁣
➰ Don’t compare your Day 1 to someone else’s Year 1⁣
⁣
➰Embrace and love YOUR natural texture. Having goals for 3b hair when you’re naturally 2a is unrealistic (and will only lead to disappointment)⁣
 ⁣
➰ Bought a new product and it didn’t work the first time? Try it again. Then again and again. Trying something once, one way, will not be sufficient enough to tell if it works. Which brings me to my next point...⁣
⁣
➰ Don’t buy ALL the things to get started. Focus on application techniques and research products before you buy them.⁣
⁣
➰ Not sure if a new technique will work? Or if you should apply your products a different way? Try it! Experimenting is how I refined my routine to give me my desired results. (Ie applying foam last VS being told it should go first).⁣
⁣
➰ There’s no miracle product or application technique to transform damaged hair overnight. Investing time in learning your hair’s needs and wants, while cutting out excessive heat, will help start your transformation.⁣ ⁣
⁣
➰ Not sure where to start? I have a detailed, step by step tutorial linked in my bio.⁣
⁣
➰ Lastly, I’ll say this until I’m blue in the face: do what works for you. One size does not fit all.⁣
⁣
_____⁣
⁣
Cheers to 5 yrs on this hair journey🥂 ⁣
⁣

What is a gel cast and how do I get one? ⁣✨⁣
⁣
Firstly, never judge a cast before it’s broken.⁣
⁣
This is what my cast looks like 99% of the time. It’s a tad wonky with a side of confused. That said, it doesn’t mean my washday has failed. ⁣
⁣
⁣
____⁣
⁣
What is a gel cast?⁣
⁣
➰ Simply put - it’s a hard shell of product that forms around your curl clumps as it dries. This helps reduce frizz while drying and maintains definition.⁣
⁣
Struggle achieving a cast? Here are just some quick tips that might help:⁣
⁣
⁣
➰ Ensure your curls are sufficiently coated with product⁣
➰ Remove a little more water before adding your hardest hold styler ⁣
➰ Use a harder hold styler ⁣(products containing Aloe or Flaxseed tend to work best for me)⁣
➰ If using heat to dry, bring the temperature down. ⁣Heat may soften the cast while drying. ⁣
➰ Use alcohol free hairspray on wet/damp hair ⁣
➰ Keep your hands off while drying ⁣
➰ Try smasters technique - dry hair to 50%, then apply a little more of your styler.⁣ Finish drying.⁣
⁣
⁣
What are your favorite tricks to achieving a cast?⁣
⁣
___________⁣
⁣

I don’t love to admit this one…⁣but constant bleach did a number on my hair and in several ways.⁣
⁣
➰ Chemical damage from constantly lightening the hair strands⁣
➰ A lengthy hair care routine that required so much more attention to protein and bond repair treatments.⁣
➰ A much longer road to healthier hair (as I also refused to do a reset cut and keep my hair long)⁣
➰ Frequent visits to keep up with the blonde as I’m naturally brunette ($$$$)⁣
⁣
I was all-over blonde on and off for over 10 years, I loved it ( and honestly, I would consider doing it again if the urge struck.) I now keep highlights in my hair for dimension that have touched up only 1x a year. ⁣
⁣
When transitioning to brunette, we used Demi-permanent color to maintain a softer grow out and it was gentler on the hair. This also allowed for us to go lighter down the road, if we choose, so we don’t have to fight through permanent color which could cause worse damage.⁣
⁣
___⁣
⁣
Shout out to my fantastic colorist, @brianahamer.stylist ,who always does and amazing job keeping my healthy hair priorities at top of mind and seamlessly taking me back to brunette over the years (💛 Briana, you’re the best.)⁣

Why I never stressed about my curl type (and still don’t)…⁣
⁣
My hair in the beginning was a mess from chemical, thermal and mechanical damage. It needed time to grow out the damage and for me to learn the proper application techniques for my hair type. ⁣
⁣
I remember taking the last couple of pictures (swipe ➡️ and feeling happy there was a slight wave there, but sad it didn’t appear “clumpy” like everyone else I saw online. Even after doing ALL the things people were telling me.⁣
⁣
There is no miracle product. Time will help with hair health. Only when my hair got healthier and I learned what it needed, did it start to show its true shape 💛 learning my curl type never made a difference in the decisions I made along the way.⁣
⁣
Please don’t stress, embrace the journey. The time you invest in caring for your hair will give you so much more appreciation for it.⁣

And still learning 💛⁣
___⁣
⁣
When I first started, I didn’t want to experiment. I didn’t want to spend money on products or time learning my hair. I didn’t want to cut it off and let go of the length, even if it was all damaged ends.⁣
⁣
I just wanted someone to fix it for me and tell me EXACTLY what to do.⁣
